bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Douglas R. Dodge, December 31, 1941

div1.p: Hench sends a reprint on yellow fever to Dodge, a relative of Carroll's. He requests that Dodge help him to meet with Carroll's son, George.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Douglas R. Dodge, December 31, 1941
div1.p:
trip folder.
December 31, 1941 Dr. Douglas R. Dodge
Las Encinas Sanitarium
Pasadena, California
My dear Doctor Dodge:

My very good friend and former colleague, Dr.
Carlos Sacasa, recently visited us here, at which time he
mentioned a reprint on yellow fever which I had written and
also mentioned the interesting fact that you were a relative
of Dr. Carroll's. I thought that you might like to have a
couple of reprints of this article written to honor Dr.
Carroll and his colleagues. Should you wish more, I should
be delighted to get them for you. Also, should you wish
enlarged copies of the painting, I think I can get them for
you, too.

I am anxious indeed to meet Dr. Carroll's son in
Washington. For some reason or other, he was unable to see
me the last time I was there and indeed has not answered any
of the letters I have written him from time to time. Frankly,
I don't know why he is suspicious of me and if you could see
your way clear to speak in my behalf I would be indeed grate-
ful. I expect to be in Washington a few days after January
13 and should like indeed to have the privilege of meeting
Mr. Carroll.

Sincerely,
P. S. Hench, M. D.
